intro: Paypayrola hulkiana, commonly known as the Hulkian paypayrola, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to the cool, dry conditions of its native habitat. Paypayrola hulkiana is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
